com.persistit

Class Management.TaskStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.persistit.Management.AcquisitionTimeBase
      • com.persistit.Management.TaskStatus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Enclosing interface:
    Management

    public static class Management.TaskStatus
extends Management.AcquisitionTimeBase
implements Serializable
    Structure that describes the current status of a long-running utility task. See Management.queryTaskStatus(long, boolean, boolean) for further information.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Tests whether the supplied object is a TaskStatus with the same taskId is this one.
      String getDescription()
      Return a description of this task
      long getExpirationTime()
      System time at which this task is scheduled to be stopped if it has not finished yet.
      long getFinishTime()
      System time at which this task ended, whether normal or abnormally, or zero if the task has not ended yet.

      The most recent Exception thrown by this task.

      Messages that have been posted by this task.

      • getState

        public int getState()
        Return the state code for this task. This is one of
        • Task.STATE_NOT_STARTED
        • Task.STATE_RUNNING
        • Task.STATE_SUSPENDED
        • Task.STATE_DONE
        • Task.STATE_FAILED
        • Task.STATE_ENDED
        • Task.STATE_EXPIRED
        Returns:
        The state

      • getStateString

        public String getStateString()
        Return the name of the state this task is in. One of "notStarted", "running", "done", "suspended", "failed", "ended", or "expired".
        Returns:
        A readable name of the task's current state

      • getStatusSummary

        public String getStatusSummary()
        A short (under 40 character) readable String summarizing the current status.
        Returns:
        A short readable status
